result.execSummary:
The defendant Elijah James Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Elijah James Powell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Elijah James Powell was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Elijah James Powell was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with count three and with the sentence in case 14CF5522.  Credit for 37 days.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
**AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Court waived all costs, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge as the Court already ordered these to be paid in case 14CF5522.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two and with sentence in case 14CF5522.  Credit for 37 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah James Powell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (64 pages) commencing JUNE 25, 2015 received and filed. kl
Original Transcript (65 pages) commencing 06/30/2015 PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Crystal S. and Detricia J.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 37 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 3 and to the sentence in case #14CF5522.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 37 days credit CONCURRENT to Count 2 and to the sentence in case #14CF5522.


Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample on Count 2.

Court WAIVED all the costs, assessments, and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) as the Court already ordered these to be paid in case #14CF5522.


Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  


Filed:  
Victim Impact Statement    
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letters in support of the defendant

Defendant Elijah James Powell in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Elijah James Powell in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed. 

As to Count 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

As to Count 3: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Letter from Defendant received and filed with court.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Elijah James Powell not in court, in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense just received a global offer.  Matter rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah James Powell in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Elijah James Powell in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who l waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.    Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Elijah James Powell in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  State requests an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Julie and Kevin K. or their residence; Stennen J

Defendant Elijah James Powell in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Elijah James Powell in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
